intro: Gnaphalium subspicatum, commonly known as the slender feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, narrow leaves and has a tufted growth habit. The flowers are usually yellow or white, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
